ygData.subject: A new competition for general video game playing

Subject: A new competition for general video game playing
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=206967455
X-Yahoo-Profile: jtogel
From: Julian Togelius <julian@...>

Hi all,

NEAT and HyperNEAT have previously performed well on the General Atari
Game Playing benchmark, and has also been applied to the General Game
Playing competition. We now invite you to try the next level in
game-based benchmarking: the General Video Game Playing Competition.

You participate in the competition by submitting a controller that can
play not just a single game, but any game that adheres to certain
standards. Submitted will be tested on a battery of unseen games,
which they cannot have been optimised for; therefore, this competition
will test general-purpose video game playing skill rather than tweaks
and tricks for  a single game. The competition is built around a
framework that can play any game encoded in the Video Game Description
Language. The software package includes 10 games, mostly
reimplementations of classic 2D arcade games, that you can train your
controller on.

Learn more about the competition and what you need to do to get
started with your own agent here:
http://gvgai.net/

The competition will run at the IEEE CIG conference for the first time
this year, and we anticipate that the competition will keep running
and developing for several years.

We hope you will be interested in participating!

Julian, on behalf of the GVG AI team: Diego, Spyros, Julian, Tom and Simon

-- 
Julian Togelius
Associate Professor
IT University of Copenhagen
Rued Langgaards Vej 7, 2300 Copenhagen, Denmark
